DOC.HEAD: Colombian Intelligence Officer, Peruvian Congressman Arrested
DOC.TEXT: A Colombian intelligence officer who swallowed drugs and a Peruvian congressman who failed to declare $25,000 in cash have been arrested by U.S. Customs agents in separate incidents, a spokesman said. Hernando Parra-Londono, a Colombian military intelligence officer, was detained at Miami International Airport after getting off an Avianca flight from Medellin, Colombia, on Thursday, Customs spokesman Michael Sheehan said. He told inspectors he had come to Miami to visit a heart doctor, but was taken to Jackson Memorial Hospital for X-rays after he displayed nervous and suspicious behavior, Sheehan said Saturday. At the hospital Thursday evening, Parra-Londono admitted swallowing cocaine pellets, and as of Saturday had passed more than 100 weighing about two pounds, Sheehan said. No formal charges will be filed until Parra-Londono had finished passing the pellets, he added. In an unrelated case Friday, Peruvian Congressman Enrique Lujan Pujada, 48, was arrested and charged with failing to declare more than $25,000 in cash. He initially told inspectors when he arrived aboard an Aero Peru flight that he had $5,000 in cash and another $5,000 in checks. But when inspectors said they intended to pat him down, he admitted he had more cash, and they found $30,280 in his pockets, Sheehan said.
